text: hi everyone Anthony Fantino here
internets busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new laser wolf
record the Beast of left and right these
guys are a mostly instrumental rock and
metal trio they have a few records under
their belt at this point this is their
latest release and I've been seriously
anticipating this record ever since I
heard a few tracks off of it namely the
song beast reality centerpiece and the
songs I was hearing off to sell p were a
tight head-spinning combination of
thrash metal progressive rock and math
rock meaning rock music with a lot of
time signatures breakneck changes in
tempo or groove tracks like beast
reality showed off a lot of technical
chops but didn't feel too flashy for
just the average rock or metal listener
to enjoy the solos on this record for
the most part are very sharp
the musical passages and the riffs are
very colorful they're playful they're
not overly dark or serious in terms of
emotion even on the moodier parts of
this record this is an explosive and
pretty fun rock record but there are
certain aspects of it I'm not that into
namely the vocals a lot of them are very
distant they're thrown into the
background they're mixed low they're
slathered and reverb on any other band's
record these vocals the vocals that
sound like this that had this tone would
be background vocals but Laser wolf
treats them like they are foreground
vocals even making way for them in the
compositions of the drums and the
guitars but simultaneously aside from a
few screams here and there they are so
quiet in comparison to the guitars to me
this just sounds like they can't commit
to vocals they want to do vocals but
they don't want to quite make a bold
upfront in-your-face vocal but
instrumentally these guys have
incredible explosive energy they are a
fierce well-oiled machine
but like the vocals there is an
instrumental aspect to this album too
that doesn't go quite far enough and
that's with composition that's with
writing I feel like some of these songs
are kind of unsurprising these guys
aren't quite like behold the arc to
posts or anything like that
instrumental metal trio that takes their
instrumental license to write tracks
that are twisted winding mind-bending
unfortunately lazer wolf doesn't really
take that many risks on this record
especially on the longer tracks here
which I think are in the most need of
risks like the opener on here where for
over eight minutes lazer wolf is
dressing and redressing and fussing over
pretty much the same melodic themes and
chord progressions from nearly the
entire track I feel the same sense of
disappointment from the song who were
the mound builders to a song that given
its intro I was hoping would have more
of an acoustic and clinician as soon as
these acoustic guitars which are very
nice open the track up
they are overtaken very quickly as some
electric guitar is thrown into the mix
and it pretty much just bodies whatever
accompaniment or counterpoint the
acoustic guitar is bringing there are
some longer tracks on this LP though
that do have more experimental ideas
some bolder variations like choose again
left-hand path I love the syncopated
high pitched guitar leads on that they
just fit so tightly with the drums again
beast reality is great but some of the
weirdest sounds and ideas out of this
entire LP come from the shorter tracks
like Lagarto or the triple trap which
has these fast sharp jarring guitar
tapping that makes this one of the most
standout tracks on the entire record
generally this record is a fun listen
but for an instrumental band they don't
seem to be pushing things much further
than other metal and rock outfits out
there that aren't instrumental but from
some of the stranger parts on this
record I gathered they could go down
that road if they wanted and they could
do something that features stronger
vocals as well if the vocals in general
were placed in a better spot in the mix
I think this would be a better record as
is but even without that change it is a
good listen I'm feeling a decent 7 on
this thing transition if you've given
this LP listen what did you think of it
did you love it did you hate it why what
do you think I should review next
anthony Fantana lazer wolf
forever
